titleInfo.title: Uher v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: CONSENT to Jurisdiction by US Magistrate Judge - upon consent of parties, this case is transferred to Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett for final disposition. (JAE, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:07-cv-03215; Uher v. Social Security Administration;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: CONSENT to Jurisdiction by US Magistrate Judge - upon consent of parties, this case is transferred to Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett for final disposition. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Uher v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 15 Motion to Reverse and Remand and for Final Judgment. The final decision of the Commissioner is reversed, and this matter is remanded pursuant to sentence four of section 205(g), 42 U.S.C. ยง 405(g),1 for a de novo hearing before an Administrative Law Judge. The Administrative Law Judge shall conduct a de novo hearing and issue a new decision. Plaintiff shall be afforded the opportunity to appear and present new evidence at the hearing. Judgment will be entered separately pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 56. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:07-cv-03215; Uher v. Social Security Administration;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 15 Motion to Reverse and Remand and for Final Judgment. The final decision of the Commissioner is reversed, and this matter is remanded pursuant to sentence four of section 205(g), 42 U.S.C. ยง 405(g),1 for a de novo hearing before an Administrative Law Judge. The Administrative Law Judge shall conduct a de novo hearing and issue a new decision. Plaintiff shall be afforded the opportunity to appear and present new evidence at the hearing. Judgment will be entered separately pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 56. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Uher v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 26 Motion to vacate order of remand and motion to withdraw application for attorney's fees. The Order of Remand 16 and Judgment 17 are vacated, and the Clerk shall reopen the case. Plainitff's application for attorney's fees 18 is withdrawn. Defendant is given until 4/30/08 to file a supplemental transcript. The plaintiff shall file and serve a brief by 6/10/08; the defendant shall file and serve a brief by 7/10/08; and plaintiff may file and serve a reply brief within the time allowed by NECivR 7.1(c). Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JSF)

titleInfo.title: Uher v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER. The decision of the Commissioner is affirmed, the appeal is denied, and judgment in favor of the defendant will be entered in a separate document. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )
